title: Placement Offer "On Hold" email
content:
I got placed in a company last Thursday. Next day on Friday I got an email from the placement office that 3 candidates out of the 9 were put on "hold". What does this mean? does it mean we are no longer offered? I searched online regarding this and the answers say that the position is no longer available. Someone please clarify. The company is a reputed one and not like a startup.

Edit: Just got a mail saying that offer is no longer on hold and all the candidates who have been put on hold are now selects. I thank everyone who gave me advice perhaps it will help others if they are in the similar situation as I was.

comments.body:
The 'reputed' companies are notorious for holding back lots of offers. If the company is part of the IT/ software industry, start looking for other options (I hope you have a backup). Depending on the forecast for the next two-three years they will choose.
Also 3/9 means that they're looking to remove any unwanted resources at the very start. What's their package?
The company is KPMG, their package is 5lpa + 2lakhs retention bonus. So offer on hold means that there is a huge chance I might no get?
As harsh as it sounds, yes. An offer on hold means that it may be revoked. You should start looking for backup options.
